snippet: Lawyers for the parents of Brooke Melton said General Motors agreed to settle a second lawsuit that linked her death to faulty ignitions in millions of cars.
abstract: Lawsuit filed by family of Brooke Melton against General Motors has been withdrawn in exchange for settlement from company's compensation program; agreement removes threat of senior company officials, including chief executive Mary T Barra, having to testify under oath about GM's failure to recall defective vehicles.

byline.contributor: Hilary Stout contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Lawyers for the parents of Brooke Melton said General Motors agreed to settle a second lawsuit that linked her death to faulty ignitions in millions of cars.

headline.main: G.M. Settles Switch Suit, Avoiding Depositions
headline.print_headline: G.M. Settles Switch Suit, Avoiding Depositions
